title: N.H. woman sentenced to life in prison for fatally stabbing brother-in-law at Boston hotel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Ren Rodgers, 28, was convicted of killing 21-year-old Christopher Kellar.
She will be eligible for parole after 18 years.

By Abby Patkin December 17, 2025 | 4:06 PM 2 minutes to read A New Hampshire woman was sentenced to life in prison with the possibility of parole Wednesday after she was convicted of fatally stabbing her brother-in-law in 2021.

title: Plane crashes into parking lot in Nashua N.H., police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The plane, carrying only a pilot, crashed into the parking lot of 45 Cannongate Road, Sergeant John Cinelli said.
By Sana Muneer December 17, 2025 | 4:04 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A plane crashed into a parking lot in Nashua Wednesday afternoon, Nashua police said.

title: New Cambridge School Committee member signed agreement to never work for the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Luisa de Paula Santos resigned from Cambridge Public Schools, which she will now oversee as a member of the Cambridge School Committee.
Luisa de Paula Santos.
Courtesy of Marcia Lopes de Mello By Molly Farrar December 17, 2025 | 3:51 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Mass. school locks down over threatening call that may have been AI generated
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News “We understand that given the events of the past week, this may be a troubling incident for many members of our community,” Police Chief Richard DiPersio said.

By Sana Muneer December 17, 2025 | 3:29 PM 1 minute to read Hudson police are investigating an apparent swatting incident — prompted by a phone call that may have been AI-generated — that put Hudson High School on lockdown Wednesday morning, Police Chief Richard DiPersio said.
Police responded to the high school around 7:55 a.

title: Four people, including Brandeis professor and local minister, arrested outside Burlington ICE facility
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The group said they were attempting to deliver "care packages" to immigrant detainees inside the ICE office in Burlington.
A photo taken moments before four people attempting to deliver "care packages" to individuals in the Burlington ICE facility were arrested by police.
Rev.

title: Here are the Boston Public Library’s most-borrowed books of 2025
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Books All of the top ten most-borrowed books in 2025 were written by women.
A view of the grand staircase lions by Louis Saint-Gaudens near the entrance of The Boston Public Library.

(David L Ryan/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas December 17, 2025 | 2:58 PM 2 minutes to read The Boston Public Library released its most-checked out books in 2025 this week, and like last year, women authors dominated the list.

title: Ravens coach John Harbaugh reveals his biggest worries facing the Patriots
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots "Big plays is the biggest thing when you look at their offense.
" Ravens Bengals Football This Sunday’s contest between the Patriots and Ravens has major implications for both sides, as both teams still have a shot at winning their respective divisions.
The Patriots (11-3) have the AFC East in their control, as they can win out and guarantee their first title since 2019.

title: Chelsea family with legal status files complaint after violent ICE encounter, lawyers say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News Hilda Ramirez Sanan and her two children were detained by ICE officers while accompanying a family member to a court hearing, the ACLU said.

By Sana Muneer December 17, 2025 | 2:42 PM 2 minutes to read An immigration group filed a civil rights complaint against Immigration and Customs Enforcement on Monday on behalf of a Chelsea mother and her children with legal status who had a violent interaction with agents in September, the group said.
“My family is broken and will never be the same,” the mother said.

title: Here’s every player to win NFL MVP at age 24 and under. Will Drake Maye be next?

bullets: New England Patriots Maye will face one of the seven players on this list this week when the Patriots travel to Baltimore.

title: Boston man arrested in 1997 cold case homicide
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The suspect, Brian Keazer, was in his early 20s at the time of the homicide.
A Boston man was arrested in connection with a 1997 cold case on Tuesday.
Brian Keazer, 50, of Jamaica Plain, was arrested by officers assigned to the Boston Police Fugitive Unit at around 12:15 p.
